page.title: 02LANDSCAPE 1
page.content: BRYNCOCH IS IN A VALLEY BETWEEN DRUMAU AND MARCH HYWEL.IT IS A RURAL AREA .IT FINALLY SLOPES INTO THE RIVER NEATH .MARCH HYWEL HAS A BUSY QUARRY WHICH SPOILS THE SCENERY SOMEWHAT WITH BUSY MACHINERY WORKING ALL DAY, ALTHOUGH AT ITS MOST WE HEAR VERY LITTLE SINCE IT IS SO RURAL.ON BOTH OF THE MOUNTAINS THERE IS A LOT OF FOLIAGE AND SHRUB LAND BUT WE CAN STILL SEE THE FEW SCATTERED HOUSES ON BOTH OF THE MOUNTAINS.ON MARCH HYWEL THERE ARE LOTS OF FIELDS WITH COWS AND SHEEP SCATTERED AROUND. IN FACT OUR VILLAGE (BRYNCOCH) IS NAMED AFTER MARCH HYWEL FOR THE FERNS GO RED IN AUTUMN. THEY NAMED THE VILLAGE{RED HILL, BRYN {BEING}HILL AND{COCH}BEING RED IN THE WELSH LANGUAGE.
